name: Grand Sirenis Mayan Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Sirenis (Mayan Beach) from Feb 8th-15th.
reviews.title: NIce Grand Sirenis Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Background:
reviews.title: Fantastic Long Weekend!

likes.disliked: — 3rd floor with no elevator in our building (there was one in the attached next building)

reviews.text: My wife and I are in our early 30’s. We tend to be in bed by 11pm and up at about 7:30am. We are not on vacation for the night life.
reviews.title: Nice Family Vacation
A good stay
reviews.text: Our most recent AI’s were Bahia Principe Punta Cana in December 07, Bahia Principe Coba in December 06 and February 07. We also did a cruise in September 07.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip we traveled with family and friends ranging in age from 29 to 60. All of us have stayed at many AI’s.
reviews.title: Incredible Food/Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Grand Sirenis for 2 weeks starting Jan. 11th. We had a very enjoyable trip and met a number of great people both staff and guests.
reviews.title: Our Best Holiday!

reviews.text: Check in and all the services (room cleaning, room service, bartenders, waiters and waitresses.) were all professional and very friendly.
reviews.title: Amazing...Go There

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge service for each building is very nice. We had a problem with the flush mechanism on our toilet called the concierge and she had it fixed in 1/2 hr. We booked all our alacartes with no problems, Some the first week and more the second.
reviews.title: That's alot of marble!

reviews.text: We always found the food both plentiful and good. The alacartes were not all to our tastes but the ones we liked we booked a second time. Particularly liked being able to get steak and eggs for breakfast some days.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it completely

reviews.text: We went for 2 weeks of relaxation and had a great time.
reviews.title: Great but would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from two weeks at the Grand Sirenis Mayan Beach. Overall, we had a fabulous time and would return in a heartbeat… especially because today here in Calgary it’s minus-33 Celsius (with wind chill) … that’s almost 60 degrees colder than it was by the pool just a few short days ago! Here is our list of pros and cons about our experience:
reviews.title: Now THAT'S a vacation!

likes.liked: — Beautiful, clean, new resort with friendly and personable staff.
likes.disliked: — We had only minor complaints -- it was fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at the Grand Sirenis

likes.liked: — Location, price, the room (yes- we liked the hole in the wall)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: We stayed in the 2300 block of the Mayan Beach side of the resort, which was perfect for us; it’s in a quiet area away from the pools. Our room was very nice and clean, although I did have to ask for the mirrors to be cleaned several times (our maid was tiny; perhaps she couldn’t reach them?!). The A/C worked fine, and the overhead fan helped drown out outside noise. We tipped $2/day while we were there.
reviews.title: Grand Sirenis Mayan Beach truly grand

likes.liked: — pool closing at 6pm give us quiet evenings
likes.disliked: — the almost two hrs drive to the Cancun airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: The stall-type door to the WC is a STUPID idea. The rooms should have a proper door and a ventilation system. The big window between the bathroom and the bedroom was livable for us as we are used to an open en suite bathroom at home; but would not be suitable for families. We did have a musty smell in the room the first few days, but we called the front desk and someone came and fixed whatever it was (note to management; perhaps that should be done in every room prior to new guests checking in!) Also, outside noise does rather echo down the concrete corridors outside and the noisy jungle birds will probably wake you up early if you are sensitive to noise (you could wear earplugs, I suppose).
reviews.title: Grand Sirenis not so grand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds:
reviews.title: Not really a 5* resort.

reviews.text: First of all this resort is huge and they are building on to it. Arriving after dark seemed a little daunting at first, but you get used to it in the daylight and very quickly find your favourite spots.
reviews.title: Great vacation!

likes.liked: — Rooms, coffee shop, service and drinks

reviews.title: Grand Sirenis
reviews.text: I stayed in building 19, where all of the rooms have a beach view. The ground floor room balconies are about 5 feet+ off the ground, so there is no access to the beach via your balcony. The room was great, very open.

Yes there is an opening between the bathroom and room, but I found it nice. When you are getting ready, you can still see the beach and you don't feel like you're closed in the bathroom. The bathroom has a toilet room with a frosted glass swinging door (no latch), a shower where you can use the shower head, the 6 jets down the wall or the detachable shower head, which also has frosted glass doors. Nice amenities included the usual cream, shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, also sewing kit, slippers, robes and a magnifying mirror. There is a big jacuzzi tub with a detachable shower head as well. One of the people I travelled with had a frosted glass partition where the hole in the wall is between the bathroom and bedroom, maybe if sharing with someone, they could accomodate with one of those rooms?
reviews.title: Nice but not 5 Star

reviews.text: There is an in room safe, lots of hangars for clothes, a mini bar which includes a coffee maker, and water soft drinks and beer are also restocked everyday.
reviews.title: had a great time

reviews.text: In the room you can have your choice of 2 (double or queen, I'm not sure) beds or 1 king bed. There is also a pull out couch for more sleeping room.
reviews.title: Straight & Honest

likes.liked: — Rooms, Coffee House, Beach, close to Tulum & Akumal

aka: Grand Sirenis Mayan Beach Resort And Spa
